details.title: Congress allotted 38 minutes, BJP 3 hours 33 minutes to debate on No Confidence Motion
details.content: The  Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), which has the majority of 273 MPs has been given 3 hours and 33 minutes in the debate. The main Opposition party, Congress, has been allocated 38 minutes to present its views on the motion. Congress chief Rahul Gandhi and the leader of the party in the House, Mallikarjun Kharge will begin the discussion.

details.title: Congress to get 38 minutes, BJP 3 hours 33 minutes to debate
details.content: The  Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), which has the majority of 273 MPs has been given 3 hours and 33 minutes in the debate. The main Opposition party, Congress, has been allocated 38 minutes to present its views on the motion. Congress chief Rahul Gandhi and the leader of the party in the House, Mallikarjun Kharge will begin the discussion.

details.title: PM Narendra Modi urges MPs to conduct disruption free debate
details.content:
Today is an important day in our Parliamentary democracy. I am sure my fellow MP colleagues will rise to the occasion and ensure a constructive, comprehensive & disruption free debate. We owe this to the people & the makers of our Constitution. India will be watching us closely.

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) July 20, 2018
READ MORE : India will be watching us today, writes Narendra Modi
TDP MP Galla Jayadev to begin the discussion, Congress President Rahul Gandhi to likely to speak at 11.30 am.
Rajnath Singh, Rakesh Singh, Virendra Singh Mast and Arjun Ram Meghwal to speak from the government on No Confidence Motion in Lok Sabha today.
BJP President Amit Shah, Parliamentary Affairs Ministers Ananth Kumar, Vijay Goel, BJP MP Bhupinder Yadav arrive at the Parliament ahead of the No Confidence vote. (Photo| Shekhar Yadav/ EPS)

details.title: What is No Confidence Motion?
details.content: A motion of no confidence is a statement or vote which states that a government is failing to carry out obligations, or is making decisions that other members feel are detrimental or is no longer deemed fit to be in power. The first No Confidence Motion was moved by Acharya Kripalani in Lok Sabha in August 1963 after the India–China War of 1962.
Samajwadi party chief Mulayam Singh Yadav arrives at parliament House. (Photo| Shekhar Yadav/ EPS)

details.title: How many No Confidence Motion has been moved in the past?
details.content:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be facing the vote of trust for the first time in his four years tenure. 

Twenty-six No Confidence Motions have been moved till date. Prime Minister Indira Gandhi faced it 15 times, followed by Lal Bahadur Shastri and Narasimha Rao who faced it three times each. Morarji Desai faced it two times and Jawahar Lal Nehru, Rajiv Gandhi, Atal Bihari Vajpayee have faced in once.
Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) likely to stage walk out before the begining of the No Confidence motion vote.

details.title: AIADMK, PMK likely to forgo no-trust vote
details.content: Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami has given a clear indication that his party would not support the motion sponsored by opposition parties, PMK MP Anbumani Ramadoss will not take part in the discussion on the motion since he has ‘pre-occupations’ at Thailapuram to address a Party meeting during the next two days.
Union Home minister Rajnath Singh arrives at the Parliament house for the No Confidence Motion. (Shekhar Yadav/ EPS)

details.title: Shiv Sena to abstain from voting
details.content: All the 18 MPS of Shiv Sena to absatin from voting against the Modi government.
PM Narendra Modi's meeting with senior BJP leaders including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh, underway in Parliament.
Lok Sabha session underway amidst ruckus.

details.title: Voting to take place at 6 pm today
details.content: Lok Sabha speaker Sumitra Mahajan says voting on No Confidence Motion will take place at 6 pm today. She added, if required the lunch hour will be skipped.
Opposition livid over time allotment, BJD walks out
This is the first No Confidence Motion debate to take place in the Lok Sabha in 15 years.

details.content:
Congress party request @S_MahajanLS to no put any limitation on time during discussion. Mallikarjun Kharge reminds that in the past no confidence motion debates for as long as five days. Mahajan doesn't budge.

details.title: TDP MP Jayadev Galla initiates the No Confidence debate
details.content: "The saga of Andhra Pradesh during this Modi-Shah regime is a saga of empty promises," says Jayadev Galla.

The BJP along with the erstwhile Congress government is equally guilty of crippling Andhra Pradesh, says TDP MP Jayadev Galla.

details.content: "Madhya Pradesh has been the leading state in terms of women's development. Madhya Pradesh is one of the states which has seen speedy development ever since BJP came to power in 2003. Before that the state was only known for lack of infrastructure and drought," added Rakesh Singh.

details.title: What is a privilege motion ?
details.content: A privilege motion is a notice by any member of either House of a state legislature or Parliament, against anyone who are accused of breach of privilege. Parliamentary privileges are certain rights and immunities enjoyed by MPs, MLAs and MLCs, individually and collectively, so that they can effectively discharge their functions.

details.title: Rajnath Singh starts speech in Lok Sabha
details.content: Home minister Rajnath Singh starts speech in Lok Sabha, says Opposition has been forced to unite against Modi Government.

details.title: Opposition failing to read people's mandate: Rajnath Singh
details.content: "After 15 years, a No Confidence Motion has been moved against a govt. We never moved a no-confidence motion in ten years when Congress was in power because we understood that the Congress had people's mandate. The Opposition should understand that this NDA governmnet has biggest majority since Independence.The Opposition has brought the no-confidence motion, so they are apparently failing to read the trust letter given by the people," Says Union Home Minister and BJP leader Rajnath Singh.

details.title: No trust among Opposition: Rajnath Singh
details.content: There is no trust among the Opposition parties, If we raise the topic of leadership the third front will fall on its face, says Home Minister Rajnath Singh.

details.content: "Instead of asking for special status, Andhra Pradesh should work towards development with the given special assistance. The Central Government will do as much we can to provide assistance to Andhra Pradesh," said Home Minister Rajnath Singh while concluding his speech.
Instead of blaming the Congress government, the BJP should worked towards development, said bihar MP Tariq Anwar.

Ram Vilas Paswan, today in the Parliament said,"More representation of minorities and villagers is required in judicial services".

details.title: France and India concluded in 2008 a Security agreement, which legally binds the two States to protect the classified information
details.content:
We have noted the statement of Mr Rahul Gandhi before the Indian Parliament. France and India concluded in 2008 a Security agreement, which legally binds the two States to protect the classified information provided by the partner:France statement 1/2

— ANI (@ANI) July 20, 2018

details.title: French Government issues statement against Rahul Gandhi's comment on Rafale deal
details.content:
“We have noted the statement of Mr Rahul Gandhi before the Indian Parliament. France and India concluded in 2008 a security agreement, which legally binds the two States to protect the classified information provided by the partner that could impact security and operational capabilities of the defence equipment of India or France. These provisions naturally apply to the IGA concluded on 23 September 2016 on the acquisition of 36 Rafale aircraft and their weapons. As the President of the French Republic indicated publicly in an interview given to India Today on 9th March 2018, “In India and in France, when a deal is very sensitive, we can’t reveal all details.”

(ANI)

details.title: Rahul Gandhi stands with his statement
details.content: Rahul Gandhi stands by his statement on Rafale deal. He has said, “Let them deny, I stand by my statement. I, Anand Sharma and Manmohan Singh were present at the meeting with French President.”

It would have been good on Rajnath Singh’s part if he had told what the Centre has done to Andhra Pradesh in the last 4 years instead of saying I am a good friend: AP CM N Chandrababu Naidu on Home Minister Rajnath Singh's comment on him in Lok Sabha (ANI)

details.title: CPI(M) President Sitaram Yechury takes a dig at PM Modi as he continues his speech in Lok Sabha
details.content:
The PM continues to repeat jumlas and read out some fudged data. The status of the Economy and livelihood conditions of our people is a lived reality. People will defeat this economic assault and the frenzied polarisation of our society.

— Sitaram Yechury (@SitaramYechury) July 20, 2018
Curse me if you want, not the soldiers fighting at the borders: PM Modi
PM Narendra Modi takes a dig at Sonia Gandhi, calls her arrogant to have claimed that numbers in the Parliament are in Congress’ favour.

How can I look him (Rahul Gandhi) in the eye, I am a poor person coming from a backward class, how can I look a "namdar" in his eye, says Narendra Modi.

Earlier Rahul Gandhi in his speech said, "PM Narendra Modi can't look me in the eye".
PM Narendra Modi ridicules Rahul's wink in Lok Sabha
BJP shouts "Modi, Modi" as Prime Minister, countering Rahul Gandhi's attack said "he is a bhagidar as well as a chowkidar but not a Saudagar like the Congress government".

The entire country saw what the eyes did today. It is clear in front of everyone: PM Modi in Lok Sabha #NoConfidenceMotion pic.twitter.com/I5C0CWFJ9K

— ANI (@ANI) July 20, 2018

details.title: Narendra Modi ridicules former Congress President Sonia Gandhi
details.content:
I read a statement- "who says we do not have the numbers."

See her arrogance.

I was reminded about 1999 the she stood outside Rashtrapati Bhavan and said- we have 272 and more are joining us. She destabilised Atal Ji's Government and never formed one herself: PM @narendramodi

— PMO India (@PMOIndia) July 20, 2018
PM Modi attempts to pacify the protesting TDP leaders who have moved the no-confidence motion against the govt, says, “Telugu meri maa hai.”

Atal Ji created 3 states- Uttarakhand, Chhattisgarh and Jharkhand. It was done peacefully. These states are now prospering. Congress divided Andhra Pradesh and their conduct then was shameful: PM Modi in Lok Sabha

details.title: There is no bigger indicator of no-confidence, than the fact that his erstwhile ally, TDP has moved this: Sitaram Yechury
details.content:
Modi haranguing against other opposition parties! But there is no bigger indicator of no-confidence, than the fact that his erstwhile ally, TDP has moved this. They had ministers at the Centre, till a few months ago. BJP’s allies themselves, don’t have any confidence in this govt

— Sitaram Yechury (@SitaramYechury) July 20, 2018

details.title: I warned Chandrababu Naidu: PM Narendra Modi
details.content: I had told Chandrababu Naidu that he is getting stuck with YSR. Now I'm seeing that the problem is domestic but the platform being used is the Parliament, said Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

details.title: Center will keep on working for AP: Modi
details.content: I want to tell the people of Andhra Pradesh that we will keep working for them. We will do everything possible for the development of AP: PM Modi

details.title: Somebody should stop Modi : Sanjay Jha
details.content:
Somebody give Modi a hug and tell him to stop. Yawn! He has not answered a single question raised. Utter nonsense, full-on rhetorical rubbish. Spare the nation, please!

— Sanjay Jha (@JhaSanjay) July 20, 2018

Loans were given over the phone in Congress rule, the web of NPAs was spread during this time:PM Modi in Lok Sabha pic.twitter.com/lRUkdr9mhR

— ANI (@ANI) July 20, 2018

Sitaram Yechury took to Twitter and wrote "Bizarre! For the first time in the history of no-confidence motions has the PM’s reply been so disconnected with reality. What he is saying has nothing to do with issues raised by the Opposition and his own allies".
The NDA government stands with the Muslim women and their quest for justice: PM Modi

details.title: Punish those involved in lynching: PM Modi
details.content: "Any incident of violence brings shame to the nation. I will once again urge the state governments to punish those who indulge in violence," says PM Modi on lynchings as TDP keeps on raising slogans demanding justice.

details.title: Yogendra Yadav rubbishes Narendra Modi's speech
details.content:
PM makes a startling claim in his speech:
Total loans sanctioned by all banks in the country: 1947-2008 = ₹ 18 L Cr
2008-2014 = ₹ 34 L Cr

Given his track record of presenting stylized facts, can someone do fact check please?

— Yogendra Yadav (@_YogendraYadav) July 20, 2018
The BJP Lok Sabha members chant," Modi,Modi" as the Prime Minister concludes his speech.
MP Pappu Yadav walks out from Lok Sabha before voting
Voting on the no-confidence motion commences in the House. Speaker Sumitra Mahajan calls for those in favour of the motion and those against it.
No Confidence Motion defeated in Lok Sabha: Noes 325. Ayes 126. Total 451.
The Lok Sabha adjourned till Monday July 23.

details.title: Prime Minister thanks those parties which voted against the No Confidence motion
details.content:
NDA has the confidence of the Lok Sabha and the 125 crore people of India.

I thank all the parties that have supported us in the vote today. Our efforts to transform India and fulfil the dreams of our youth continue. Jai Hind!

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) July 20, 2018

details.title: DMK President MK Stalin took a jibe at AIADMK for supporting the Modi government
details.content:
Support for Modi Govt in #NoConfidence despite NEET, 15th Finance Commission, GST, Hindi imposition and communal politics is further proof of the quid pro quo arrangement between ADMK and BJP. IT raids on Chief Minister Edapadi Palaniswami's family have achieved their objective.

— M.K.Stalin (@mkstalin) July 20, 2018
Chandrababu Naidu addresses press conference after No Confidence motion.

As part of our continuous fight, we introduced this no-confidence motion. In the last four years, I went to Delhi 29 times. Instead of doing justice to AP, he is resorting political attack on me alleging I took U-turn : TDP chief & AP CM N Chandrababu Naidu pic.twitter.com/DdmhrWhL7t

— ANI (@ANI) July 20, 2018

details.title: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj congratulates PM Modi
details.content:
प्रधान मंत्री जी - भारी बहुमत से विश्वास मत जीतने पर आपको मेरी हार्दिक बधाई.
Pradhan Mantri ji - My heartiest congratulations on winning the vote of confidence with a huge margin. @narendramodi

— Sushma Swaraj (@SushmaSwaraj) July 20, 2018

We posed questions to PM Modi on Rafael deal, Nirav Modi etc but he didn't answer any. His speech was 'dramebaazi.' He didn't say anything for people of Andhra Pradesh. He was telling us what previous govts have done & not what his govt has done in 4 years: M.Kharge, Congress.

"It is not about majority, it is about morality. Morality won today. We wanted to showcase failures of PM and his govt. You take unemployment, farmers distress, economic slowdown and more. He has failed on every aspect and lost trust of people of the country," says TDP MP K Srinivas.

Congress president @RahulGandhi after  the #NoConfidenceMotion proceedings at parliament house in New Delhi on Friday. @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/EHSCDQSMG0

— Shekhar Yadav (@Shekharyadav02) July 20, 2018

details.title: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor says the process was successful
details.content: "Basic message is that the journey is more important than the destination. Failures of the BJP govt were put before the nation. Outcome was predictable but the process was successful," said Shashi Tharoor.
